com.client.GUI.collision

Class GUICollisionObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.client.GUI.panels.GUIPanel
      • com.client.GUI.panels.GUIPanelMovable
        • com.client.GUI.collision.GUICollisionObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GUICollisionObjectBox, GUICollisionObjectCircle

    public abstract class GUICollisionObject
extends GUIPanelMovable
    Abstract class defining a collidable object. These are useful for the GUI. GUI panels usually contain at least one of the concrete classes derived from this, and user input is tested against them.
    Author:
    Ian

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DRAW
      Whether to draw the collision object(s).

      Executes the click function, if there is one.
      void executeFunctionMoveEnter()
      Executes the enter function, if there is one.
      void executeFunctionMoveExit()
      Executes the exit function, if there is one.
      void setFunctionClick(Function function_click)
      Sets the function to call whenever the mouse is clicked inside this collision object.
      void setFunctionEnter(Function function_enter)
      Sets the function to call whenever the mouse enters this collision object.
      void setFunctionExit(Function function_exit)
      Sets the function to call whenever the mouse exits this collision object.

        public void executeFunctionMoveExit()
        Executes the exit function, if there is one.

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables the collision object. Subclasses should not collide if the collision object is disabled.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables the collision object. Subclasses should not collide if the collision object is disabled.
